text: hi I'm Adam Harvey I'm an artist in New
York and I'm working with surveillance
fashion privacy and what that means in
today's context it bothers me a lot to
know that when I do those average
day-to-day things that somebody could be
watching me and that that is really a
frustrating feeling to know that you
always have a chaperone or somebody
monitoring what you do the anti
paparazzi clutch is a project I started
in 2009 and it's a device that goes
inside of a purse and when a paparazzi
photographer takes your photo it flashes
back with enough light so that it over
exposes the photo technically it has a
device a sensor which looks for flash
coming from a camera and as soon as that
happens it triggers a Bank of LEDs and
what's unique about that is that there's
no recycle time I have some flashes have
that so this can fire as often as he
needed to and the time it takes for the
light to be triggered is short enough
that it'll hit the photographer's sensor
and overexposed their photo
